summary: Email correspondence between an FBI forensic accountant and another party regarding the status of subpoenas, specifically for American Express records, and coordination to review analysis of financial records. The document shows ongoing investigative work into financial aspects of the Epstein case in October 2019.

persons.name: Ori
persons.context: FBI forensic accountant based at the New York Field Office who is coordinating subpoena requests for American Express records and offering to present analysis to another party.

events.title: Coordination for Subpoena Review
events.description: Email exchange regarding scheduling a meeting at the FBI field office to review analysis of subpoena returns and discuss the status of over 20 subpoenas issued.

locations: FBI New York Field Office, 26 Federal Plaza, NYC, NY 10278
keyFacts: The FBI was actively issuing subpoenas for financial records, including American Express records, as part of the Epstein investigation in October 2019.
Over 20 subpoenas had been cut by the FBI forensic accounting team at that time.
Coordination was underway to review the analysis of subpoena returns and ensure all received materials were shared.
The correspondence indicates an ongoing financial investigation, with specific focus on credit card records.
